input_text:
Job Title: Transportation Engineer

Location: Lawrence, KS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Job details

Multiple Disciplines

This Jobot Job is hosted by Justin Rice

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $110,000 - $150,000 per year

A Bit About Us

We have a welcoming, fun, and laid-back culture that encourages communication and collaboration where our greatest strength is our team members. If you value great work-life integration and work best in a relaxed, supportive, and inclusive environment, we may be the place where you ARE the best version of yourself. We are a relationship-based company that prioritizes building people and providing opportunities.

With a rich history and a commitment to excellence, we have been serving clients since 1937. We are a leading multidisciplinary firm working hard to improve the communities in which we live, work and play. Join us and become part of our team that blends expertise, fun and passion for serving each other and our communities. Together, we can make a difference while building a rewarding career!



Why join us?


Great benefits

Consistent Bonus

2-4 weeks PTO

401k match up to 3%

Profit sharing after 1 year

Hybrid flexibility

Outstanding company culture and retention

Job Details

Professional Engineer License REQUIRED

$100-140k Base Salary (DOE) + up to 15% Bonus

Must Be Located near/within Overland Park, Wichita, Lawrence, OR Topeka

Job Summary

Our Transportation Department provides expertise and services including traffic engineering, transportation planning, roadway and bridge design, and environmental services. This position is supported by a department of professionals to support managing successful projects that exceed client expectations while meeting our financial goals.

Responsibilities and Duties

Lead engineering teams on scoping and design for multiple projects

Successfully complete assigned projects according to budgets and schedules

Develop Roadway Design plans and contract documents

Perform Roadway Design tasks including

Culvert and storm sewer designs

Horizontal and vertical alignments

Typical section development

Geometrics and grades

Development of roadway cross sections and/or corridor model

Ensure completeness and quality of the design related forms and reports

Develop and review cost estimates and calculation of construction quantities

Demonstrate advanced use of CADD and assure compliance with project CADD standards

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in civil/transportation engineering

Professional Engineer (PE) license

6+ years' of transportation engineering experience

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button.

Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?

Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
